Name: Acretin
Uses: Treatment of acne vulgaris, hyperpigmentation and fine wrinkling of photodamaged skin, and acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL)​

Name: Adol

Dosage Limit: Adults: 500-1000 mg every 4-6 hours, up to 4000 mg/day. Children: Dose varies by age and weight

Name: Aggrex

Dosage Limit: Adults: 325-650 mg every 4-6 hours, up to 4000 mg/day. Children: Not recommended for children under 12 years due to the risk of Reye's syndrome

Name: Airoplast
Uses: Dressing retention; suitable for patients sensitive to traditional tapes.

Uses: Anti-inflammatory and anti-edematous; used for the reduction and resorption of edema and exudates, adjunctive therapy in inflammatory conditions

Name: Antopral

Name: Asmakast

Name: Augmentin
Uses: Antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, skin infections, and ear infections.
Dosage Limit: Dosage typically depends on the severity of the infection and the patient's age and weight. Common dosages range from 250 mg/125 mg to 875 mg/125 mg taken orally every 8 or 12 hours.

Name: Betaderm
Uses: Corticosteroid cream or ointment used to reduce inflammation, itching, redness, and swelling associated with various skin conditions like eczema, dermatitis, and psoriasis.

Name: Betadine
Uses: Antiseptic solution used to clean and disinfect wounds, cuts, and burns. Also used as a pre-operative skin cleanser.

Name: Bivatracin
Uses: Antibiotic ointment used to prevent and treat minor skin infections caused by bacteria.

Uses: Herbal cough syrup used to relieve cough and soothe the throat.

Name: Brufen
Uses: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever associated with conditions such as headache, toothache, menstrual cramps, muscle aches, and arthritis.
Dosage Limit: The recommended dosage for adults is typically 200 mg to 800 mg every 4 to 6 hours as needed for pain relief or fever reduction. The maximum daily dose should not exceed 3200 mg.

Name: C Zinc
Uses: Zinc supplement; specific uses not provided.
Dosage Limit: The recommended daily allowance (RDA) for zinc varies by age and gender. Consult a healthcare professional for appropriate dosing.

Name: Carbamide

Name: Ceftriaxone
Uses: Antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as pneumonia, meningitis, gonorrhea, and intra-abdominal infections.
Dosage Limit: Dosage depends on the type and severity of the infection, as well as the patient's age and weight. It is usually administered intravenously or intramuscularly once or twice daily.

Name: Celebrex
Uses: NSAID used to relieve pain, inflammation, and stiffness caused by arthritis, osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and ankylosing spondylitis.
Dosage Limit: The usual recommended dosage for osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis is 100 mg to 200 mg taken orally once or twice daily. The maximum daily dose should not exceed 400 mg.

Name: Cetal
Uses: Antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis (hay fever) such as sneezing, runny nose, itching, and watery eyes.

Uses: Likely similar to Cetal but formulated specifically for sinus relief.

Name: Ciprodiazole

Ciprofloxacin: Fluoroquinolone antibiotic.
Metronidazole: Antibiotic, antiprotozoal.
Uses: Treats urinary tract, respiratory tract, skin, and gastrointestinal infections, Used for bacterial vaginosis, pelvic inflammatory disease, amoebiasis, giardiasis, trichomoniasis, and certain abdominal, skin, and joint infections.
Dosage Limit:
Varies based on the infection being treated.
For example, for trichomoniasis: 2 grams taken once or 500 mg twice daily for 7 days.

Name: Ciprofar
Uses: Treating bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections, respiratory tract.
Dosage Limit: Adult: 250-500 mg every 12 hours for 7-14 days (mild to moderate), 500-750 mg.

Name: Ciprofloxacin Tablets USP 39

Name: Clarinase

Name: Claritine
Uses:
Relief from allergy symptoms, such as sneezing, runny nose, itchy/watery eyes, and itchy throat/nose,
Treatment of chronic urticaria (hives).

Adults and Children 6 Years and Older: 10 mg once daily.
Children 2 to 5 Years: 5 mg once daily (syrup or orally disintegrating tablets).

Name: Clindasol
Uses:
Treating bacterial infections, particularly those of the skin, lungs, internal organs, and female reproductive organs.
Sometimes used for treating acne and certain types of bone infections.
Dosage Limit:
Common adult oral dosage: 150-450 mg every 6-8 hours
Dosage for children: Based on body weight, usually 8-20 mg/kg/day divided into 3-4 doses
Maximum daily dosage for severe infections: Up to 1800-2700 mg in divided doses

Name: Comfort Massage Gel

For Acute Hemorrhoidal Attacks: Initial dose of 3,000 mg per day for the first 4 days, then 2,000 mg per day for the next 3 days.
For Hemorrhoidal Disease: Typically, 500 mg twice daily.

Dosage Limit: Adults: 200-400 mg every 4-6 hours, up to 3200 mg/day. Children: Dose varies by age and weight, consult a doctor.

Name: Aspirin
Uses: Pain relief, anti-inflammatory, fever reduction, prevention of heart attacks and strokes
Dosage Limit: Adults: 325-650 mg every 4-6 hours, up to 4000 mg/day. Children: Not recommended for children under 12 years due to the risk of Reye's syndrome.

Name: Tylenol
Uses: Pain relief, fever reduction
Dosage Limit: Adults: 325-650 mg every 4-6 hours, up to 3000 mg/day. Children: Dose varies by age and weight, consult a doctor.

Name: Nyquil
Uses: Relief of cold and flu symptoms, such as cough, sore throat, fever, and congestion
Dosage Limit: Adults and children over 12 years: 30 mL every 6 hours, up to 120 mL/day. Children under 12 years: Consult a doctor.

Name: Bronchopro
Uses: Treatment of respiratory disorders associated with viscid or excessive mucus, such as acute and chronic bronchitis, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
Dosage Limit: Adults: 30 mg (1 tablet) three times daily. Children: Dose varies by age and weight, consult a doctor.

Name: Anuva
Uses: Pain relief, anti-inflammatory, treatment of conditions such as arthritis, menstrual pain, and migraines
Dosage Limit: Adults: 50 mg two to three times daily. Maximum daily dose should not exceed 150 mg.

Name: Apidone
Uses: Treatment of nausea and vomiting, relief of symptoms of gastroparesis (delayed stomach emptying)
Dosage Limit: Adults: 10 mg three to four times daily, 15-30 minutes before meals and at bedtime if necessary. Maximum daily dose should not exceed 80 mg.

Name: Avosoya
GENERIC NAME(S): Avocado soya 300mg + Avocado oil 100 mg + Soya bean oil 200 mg
Uses: May be used as a supplement for its potential anti-inflammatory and cholesterol-lowering effects, and for improving joint health
Dosage Limit: The dosage can vary based on the formulation and the specific health condition being targeted. Consult a healthcare professional for the appropriate dosage.

Name: B.B.C.
Uses: Local anesthetic and analgesic for the relief of pain and inflammation in the mouth and throat
Dosage Limit: The dosage and frequency of use depend on the specific formulation (e.g., lozenges, spray, mouthwash). Follow the instructions on the product label or consult a healthcare professional.

Name: Catafast
Uses: Pain relief, anti-inflammatory, treatment of conditions such as arthritis, menstrual pain, and migraines
Dosage Limit: Adults: 50 mg two to three times daily. Maximum daily dose should not exceed 150 mg.

Name: Vidrop
Uses: Prevention and treatment of vitamin D deficiency, support of bone health
Dosage Limit: Dosage varies based on age, health status, and specific needs. Consult a healthcare professional for appropriate dosing.

Name: Candalkan Plus
GENERIC NAME(S): 32 mg candesartan cilexetil + 12.5 mg hydrochlorothiazide (Active Ingredient)
Uses: Used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). Candesartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) and hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic (water pill).
Dosage Limit: The dosage is determined by a healthcare professional based on the individual's blood pressure and response to treatment.

Name: Cemicresto
Uses: Used to lower cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease.
Dosage Limit: The usual starting dose is 10 mg once daily, but the dosage may be adjusted by a healthcare professional based on the individual's response and cholesterol levels.

Name: Cholerose
GENERIC NAME(S): Rosuvastatin calcium 10.4 mg (equivalent to rosuvastatin 10 mg) (Active Ingredient)
Uses: Similar to Cemicresto, used to lower cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease.
Dosage Limit: The dosage is typically 10 mg once daily, but may be adjusted by a healthcare professional.

Name: Choletimb
Uses: Used to lower cholesterol levels in the blood. It works by reducing the absorption of cholesterol in the intestines.
Dosage Limit: The usual dose is 10 mg once daily, with or without food.

Name: Enrich
GENERIC NAME(S): Vitamin A, C, E & Beta Carotene (Active Ingredients)
Uses: Used as a dietary supplement to provide essential vitamins and antioxidants.
Dosage Limit: The dosage varies based on the formulation and is specified on the product label.

Name: Farcolin
Uses: Used to relieve symptoms of asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) such as wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness.
Dosage Limit: The dosage varies based on the specific bronchodilators included and is determined by a healthcare professional.

Name: Remowax
Uses: Used to dissolve and remove earwax plugs.
Dosage Limit: The dosage and frequency of use are specified on the product label. Typically, a few sprays into the affected ear as needed.

Name: Rheumatizen
GENERIC NAME(S): Diacerein 50 mg (per gram of cream) (Active Ingredients)
Uses: Used as a topical treatment for osteoarthritis and to relieve joint pain and inflammation.
Dosage Limit: Apply a thin layer to the affected area(s) as directed by a healthcare professional.

Name: Rhinopro
GENERIC NAME(S): Phenylephrine hydrochloride 20 mg, Carbinoxamine maleate 4 mg (Active Ingredients)
Uses: Used to relieve symptoms of nasal congestion and allergies such as sneezing, runny nose, and itching.
Dosage Limit: The dosage is determined by a healthcare professional based on the individual's symptoms and response to treatment.

Name: Solvadol
GENERIC NAME(S): Glycerol, Aqua, Extract of Hedera Helix and Ribes Nigrum, Essential Oil of Eucalyptus Globulus (Active Ingredients)
Uses: Used as a throat spray to relieve symptoms of sore throat and cough.
Dosage Limit: The dosage and frequency of use are specified on the product label. Typically, a few sprays into the throat as needed.
